explanation: Agent A is correct. With OS_DEBUG defined as an empty variadic macro (#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__)), each OS_DEBUG("..."); in the function preprocessor-expands to an empty statement (effectively a lone ‘;’). Those empty statements are executed as no-ops and, in the given build configuration, can be removed without changing program behaviour. That matches the Rule 2.2 definition: "Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code." Given the provided exhaustive test traces (showing no observable effect from OS_DEBUG in this configuration) the OS_DEBUG invocations are dead code in that build, so the reported violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 is correct.
